title: BBC Local Live: Northamptonshire for Wednesday, 25 November 2015 - BBC News
summary: northampton town could be relieved of its £ 10.25m debt owed to the borough council .
northamptonshire police 's actions during a fatal crush at a northampton nightclub in 2011 were `` appropriate '' according to the ipcc .
news , sport , weather and travel updates resume at 08:00 on thursday .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's all from the northamptonshire live team for today .
we 'll be back tomorrow from 08:00 with more live news , sport , weather and travel updates for the county .

documents.title: new crop of ambulance technicians for northants
text: emas nhs trust
emasnhstrust
welcome to our new leic 's & northants technicians who have completed their training # prideinemas
welcome to our new leic 's & northants technicians who have completed their training # prideinemas

documents.title: complex job taking place on the grand union
text: i 've been in whilton today , observing a very complex project to replace two lock gates on the grand union canal .
the old gates have been removed , a section of the canal drained , and new ones lifted in by crane .
james clifton from the canal and river trust told me : `` rather like a rolls royce , they 're all bespoke because every single lock is different .
`` we have a very specialist crane which sits in the middle of a boat on the bottom of the canal - it 's got a hydraulic gib which lifts the gates into place . ''
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: bus delays in kettering
text: if you 're expecting to catch a bus in kettering this evening , expect delays following an earlier incident where a man was airlifted to hospital .
stagecoach midlands
stagecoachmids

welcome to our new leic 's & northants technicians who have completed their training # prideinemas

documents.title: man airlifted to hospital after being assaulted in kettering
text: a man has been airlifted to hospital after being attacked in kettering .
author: Northamptonshire Telegraph

documents.title: northamptonshire 's waterways being improved by new lock gates
text: a major operation is under way near daventry to replace lock gates on the grand union canal .
the old three-tonne gates at two locks at whilton have been removed , and new ones are being lifted in by crane .
a section of the canal has been drained so the work can be carried out .
it 's part of a £ 45m project by the canal and river trust to improve britain 's waterways .
hear more with rob and annabel from 16:00 .
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: corby `` disappointed '' by failed bid for enterprise zone
text: the leader of corby borough council said today 's decision by the government to reject corby 's bid for an enterprise zone is a `` big disappointment . ''
it had been hoped the zone would be centred on rockingham motor speedway , and be a joint venture with east northants council .
tom beattie said : `` although this is not the news that we wanted or expected to hear , we will continue to work hard to attract new investment into the borough . ''
author: Anna Bartlett
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: breakingcorby 's bid for enterprise zone rejected
text: the bid by corby to form an enterprise zone has been rejected by the government .
there 's bound to be disappointment as back in april , chancellor george osborne visited the county - .
and said if the conservatives were returned to power they will start discussions about setting up an enterprise zone in corby .
more to follow
author: Anna Bartlett
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: levi looking forward to two more years with northants
text: south african batsman richard levi says `` it 's great to be coming back '' to northamptonshire in the spring .
he 's agreed a new two-year contract for all formats of the game - which will be his fourth season at wantage road .
he told rob and annabel on bbc radio northampton that northants has become `` a home away from home . ''
author: Graham McKechnie
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: northampton man given indefinite sentence in secure unit
text: a man with mental health problems who beat his mother to death has been granted an indefinite sentence in a secure psychiatric unit at northampton crown court .

david love , 33 - who had been diagnosed with paranoid schizophrenia and had been receiving treatment in the community where nurses trusted him to take his own medicine - was visiting his mother , sandra thomas , in duston , northampton in april this year .
his mother 's friend , who was staying with them , told the court he had woken to see love swinging a metal television bracket at mrs thomas repeatedly .
love had earlier pleaded guilty to manslaughter with diminished responsibility .
author: Elinor Cross
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: m1 closure tonight through northants
text: if you 're planning to use the m1 through the county tonight , bear this closure in mind
highways england
highwaysemids

documents.title: a-list clients for northamptonshire tailor
text: a tailor from northamptonshire can count the likes of leonardo dicaprio and daniel craig among his clients .
tom cridland from oundle set up his business with a £ 6,000 start-up grant .
he 's now launched what he calls a 30 year sweatshirt - and 10 % of the profits go to charity .
author: Annabel Amos
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: could a local park be crowned best in uk ?
text: lovenorthampton
lovenorthampton

documents.title: northants chamber reacts to autumn statement
text: the chancellor 's autumn statement - delivered this lunchtime - has received a mixed review from the northamptonshire chamber , which represents businesses in the county .

while investment in infrastructure - which will aid the county 's logistics industry - has been welcomed , the chief executive of the chamber paul griffiths , says he 's `` disappointed '' there wo n't be any further government support when it comes to helping exporters .
mr griffiths said : we need the government to intervene and to push forward pro-growth measures . ''

documents.title: elderly people unable to keep warm
text: too many vulnerable people in northamptonshire are not keeping warm in the winter - according to the chief executive of age uk northamptonshire .
liam condron 's remarks follow the news from the office for national statistics that the number of excess winter deaths in england and wales rose to its highest level in 15 years last winter .
he told me at lunchtime : `` the fact people are living in cold homes leaves them more susceptible to flu , stroke , and respiratory problems . ''
author: Helen Blaby
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: mp holds session for workers affected by redundancies at fairline in oundle and corby
text: workers affected by the redundancies at luxury boat manufacturer fairline are being invited to a drop-in session to look at the options available to them .
author: Northamptonshire Telegraph

documents.title: latest news : pothole fund thanks to efforts of northampton mp
text: the latest headlines this afternoon :
author: Sarah Foster
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: northants mp praised by chancellor
text: the `` incessant lobbying '' of northampton north mp michael ellis has resulted in a permanent pothole fund for britain .
that 's according to the chancellor george osborne - who delivered the news in his annual spending review this lunchtime .
mr osborne said mr ellis had persuaded him to spend £ 5m on repairing potholes .

documents.title: michael ellis given credit for new pothole fund
text: a permanent pothole fund has been set up as part of today 's autumn statement - a recognition of the efforts of a campaign started by northampton north mp michael ellis .
cchq press office
cchqpress
@ george osborne : we 'll spend £ 1bn more on roads maintenance this parliament - with a permanent pothole fund # autumnstatement # spendingreview
@ george osborne : we 'll spend £ 1bn more on roads maintenance this parliament - with a permanent pothole fund # autumnstatement # spendingreview

documents.title: northants woman wins award for foster care work
text: a woman from northampton who spent her teens in foster care has won a special award .
naikoru star , 22 , received the fostering achievement for education award at the fostering network 's fostering excellence awards last week .
she now visits her former foster carer to help new foster children settle in and encourage them to work hard at school .
author: Anna Bartlett
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: northampton residents seek resolution to congestion woes
text: residents in the st james area of northampton - who have long campaigned for the joining up of two local roads - have requested a meeting with northampton borough council , northamptonshire county council and northamptonshire highways .
for four years , people have asked for st james mill road to be joined with the road end in st james retail park .
graham croucher , chairman of st james residents association , said : `` until these roads are linked all the traffic congestion problems in st james will not be even close to being eased . ''
author: Anna Bartlett
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: council going electric to drive down carbon emissions
text: staff at daventry district council will soon be able to use a new electric pool car when travelling on essential business - in an effort to be more environmentally-friendly .
the vehicle has been bought with the help of a grant from the office for low emission vehicles ( olev ) for use by staff whose jobs involve occasional business travel .
from the new year staff will be required to use this vehicle rather than use their own car - if it , or the other electric vehicle used by the council , is available .
author: Anna Bartlett
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: canal locks replaced today
text: part of the grand union canal at whilton locks in the county has been drained so lock gates can be replaced in a £ 130k improvement project .
new made to measure gates - each weighing three tonnes - will be installed here , and at the lock in long buckby , later today .
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: iconic utility repair store celebrates 25 years at northampton 's weston favell shopping centre
text: an iconic vacuum cleaner and utility repair store at weston favell shopping centre reaches a milestone today - celebrating 25 years of being open in the lower mall of the centre .
author: Northants Herald & Post

documents.title: northampton town beat crawley to stay in promotion race
text: northampton town continued to ignore takeover talk as they won away at crawley to make it seven games unbeaten .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: northampton town : loan deal is `` high risk strategy , '' say labour
text: the labour group on northampton borough council says it has reservations over the conservative authority 's decision to offset its £ 10.25m loan to the cobblers by developing the land around sixfields .

leader of the labour group , danielle stone , said the council does n't `` have a good track on development so i do n't have much confidence they are going to get this money back in the short to medium term , if ever . ''
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: no grudge against burgess - burrell
text: northampton 's luther burrell says he has no issue with sam burgess over the rugby league convert 's world cup selection .

documents.title: latest news : police action during northampton nightclub crush was `` appropriate '' broadband in northants 'unreliable '
text: the latest headlines this wednesday lunchtime :
author: Sarah Foster
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: ipcc publishes report into northampton nightclub deaths
text: police action and decisions during an incident at a northampton nightclub , in which two women died , were `` appropriate '' according to the independent police complaints commission .
nabila nanfuka , 22 , and 19-year-old laurene-danielle jackson died following a crush at the lava and ignite club in october 2011 .

the ipcc investigation also found it more than likely that police had not been informed of the event the nightclub was holding , and were only alerted when a large number of people began arriving at the club .
author: Anna Bartlett
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: northampton town : the money and the stand
text: northampton town : the money and the stand

documents.title: levi back at northants for two years
text: south african batsman richard levi will return to the county ground for two years .
northants head coach david ripley says it '' ll be `` great '' to have him back .
author: Graham McKechnie
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: levi to return for northamptonshire
text: south african batsman richard levi has renewed his contract with northamptonshire county cricket club .
the 27-year-old played in all formats of the game for the county last summer - and head coach david ripley says it 's great '' to have him back .
author: Graham McKechnie
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: northampton town : council says it had to act
text: the leader of northampton borough council , mary markham , says the authority simply had to come to an agreement to ensure the future of the cobblers .
last night , the authority agreed to offset its loan of £ 10.25m to redevelop the stadium - by selling land at sixfields for development .

councillor markham said : `` kelvin thomas quite rightly did n't want to take on the debt and neither did anyone else interested in buying the club - so we had to draw up an agreement between ourselves .
it also outlines how we will work and propose to get the £ 10.25m back on the development of the land . ''
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: government apologises after accusing wrong northamptonshire twin of being illegal immigrant
text: the home office has apologised to a northamptonshire man who was ordered to sign on at a police station because he was wrongly suspected of being an illegal immigrant .
author: Northampton Chronicle & Echo

documents.title: northampton town : deal over loan is reached
text: northampton borough council has agreed to offset a loan of £ 10.25m made to the cobblers to redevelop the stadium by selling land at sixfields that 's available for development .
it means - subject , to meeting certain conditions - the football club would then be free of debt to the borough council .
it 's also been agreed that the consortium - led by kelvin thomas - will pay off the club 's debt to hmrc , finish the east stand at sixfields , and develop conference facilities at the ground .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: grand union canal repairs under way
text: a project is under way to repair a number of locks along the grand union canal .
the £ 100,000 scheme organised by the canal and river trust has already seen the water drained from the lock at long buckby and a crane used to remove the lock gates .
new made-to-measure gates each weighing three tonnes will be installed in their place today .

documents.title: hinwick hall sold for £ 2.7m
text: hinwick hall has been soldwith a price tag of £ 2.7m .
author: Northampton Chronicle & Echo

documents.title: at last ! it 's cold enough for ice rink at northamptonshire garden centre to open
text: an ice rink at a northamptonshire garden centre and food hall has been officially opened by a 12-year-old skating champion a week after it was closed because it was too warm .
author: Northamptonshire Telegraph

documents.title: roads commitment sought in autumn statement
text: northamptonshire 's chamber of commerce wants chancellor george osborne to commit to improving infrastructure including highways in today 's autumn statement .
businesses have told the bbc that many local roads need improving .
the chamber 's chief executive paul griffiths said good roads are vitally important .
author: David Keller
BBC News

documents.title: weather : chilly morning with some showers expected later
text: it will be a dry , but chilly morning with some sunny spells and an early ground frost .
there will be a few drizzly showers later with moderate or fresh north-westerly winds , especially across high ground like arbury hill .
maximum temperature : 8c ( 46f ) .
weather has the latest .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: mp 's party received payment from northampton town developer
text: the local party of northampton south conservative mp david mackintosh received thousands of pounds in undeclared payments connected to a businessman involved in the stalled stadium redevelopment at northampton town , the bbc can reveal .
our investigation has revealed details of the payments made when mr mackintosh ( leader of northampton borough council .
mr mackintosh has declined to comment , while the conservative party says it is `` looking into the matter '' ..
in a statement , the businessman in question - howard grossman - told the bbc he paid £ 6,195 for tickets to attend an event hosted by mr mackintosh as part of his election campaign .
author: David Keller
BBC News

documents.title: latest news : mp 's party received payment connected to northampton town developer businesses want infrastructure boost in autumn statement
text: here 's the latest news this wednesday morning :
author: Andrew Radd
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: m1 and a14 congestion
text: one lane is closed southbound and there 's queuing traffic back to northampton at j15 on the m1 because of an accident near newport pagnell services .
a broken-down van is also blocking a lane on the a14 eastbound at kettering .
travel has the latest .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: good morning and welcome to northamptonshire live
text: hello and welcome to local live for northamptonshire , where we 'll be bringing you the latest news , sport , weather and travel updates until 18:00 .
to start things off we have some exclusive northampton town news to tell you about - that 's coming up very soon .
send us your stories and for us to feature throughout the day by dropping us an email , or posting on facebook or twitter .
author: David Keller
BBC News
